techmeme.title: Q&A with Booking CEO Glenn Fogel on the company's Booking.com, OpenTable, Kayak, Priceline, and Agoda brands, using AI to book trips, hotel industry, and more (Nilay Patel/The Verge)
OpenAI says it's changing the format of its DevDay conference this fall to a series of on-the-road developer sessions and GPT-5 will not be announced during it (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
Lumen, which sells data center networking and security products, says it secured new deals worth $5B from tech companies amid AI surge; LUMN up 35%+ after hours (Harshita Mary Varghese/Reuters)
Palantir raises 2024 revenue guidance to $2.74B-$2.75B and operating income guidance to $966-$974M, vs. $882.9M est., citing AI demand; PLTR up 16%+ after hours (Lizette Chapman/Bloomberg)
Researchers discover a bug, exploited since 2018, in Windows Smart App Control and SmartScreen that lets attackers avoid security warnings for unsigned binaries (Sergiu Gatlan/BleepingComputer)
